 281 -        def multisend(self, 
 282                        send, 
 283                        send_dict, 
 284                        expect=None, 
 285                        child=None, 
 286                        timeout=3600, 
 287                        check_exit=None, 
 288                        fail_on_empty_before=True, 
 289                        record_command=True, 
 290                        exit_values=None, 
 291                        escape=False, 
 292                        echo=None, 
 293                        note=None, 
 294                        loglevel=logging.DEBUG): 

 295                  """Multisend. Same as send, except it takes multiple sends and expects in a dict that are 
 296                  processed while waiting for the end "expect" argument supplied. 
 297   
 298                  @param send_dict:            dict of sends and expects, eg: {'interim prompt:','some input','other prompt','some other input'} 
 299                  @param expect:               String or list of strings of final expected output that returns from this function. See send() 
 300                  @param send:                 See send() 
 301                  @param child:                See send() 
 302                  @param timeout:              See send() 
 303                  @param check_exit:           See send() 
 304                  @param fail_on_empty_before: See send() 
 305                  @param record_command:       See send() 
 306                  @param exit_values:          See send() 
 307                  @param echo:                 See send() 
 308                  @param note:                 See send() 
 309                  """ 
 310                  expect = expect or self.get_default_expect() 
 311                  child = child or self.get_default_child() 
 312                  self._handle_note(note) 
 313                   
 314                  send_iteration = send 
 315                  expect_list = send_dict.keys() 
 316                  # Put breakout item(s) in last. 
 317                  n_breakout_items = 0 
 318                  if type(expect) == str: 
 319                          expect_list.append(expect) 
 320                          n_breakout_items = 1 
 321                  elif type(expect) == list: 
 322                          for item in expect: 
 323                                  expect_list.append(item) 
 324                                  n_breakout_items += 1 
 325                  while True: 
 326                          # If it's the last n items in the list, it's the breakout one. 
 327                          res = self.send(send_iteration, expect=expect_list, child=child, check_exit=check_exit, fail_on_empty_before=fail_on_empty_before, timeout=timeout, record_command=record_command, exit_values=exit_values, echo=echo, escape=escape, loglevel=loglevel) 
 328                          if res >= len(expect_list) - n_breakout_items: 
 329                                  break 
 330                          else: 
 331                                  send_iteration = send_dict[expect_list[res]] 
 332                  self._handle_note_after(note=note)

 367                  if type(regexps) == str:

 370                          self.fail('regexps should be list')

 386                                          if not self.match_string(output, regexp): 
 387                                                  missing = True 
 388                                                  break 
 389                                  if missing: 
 390                                          self._handle_note_after(note=note) 
 391                                          return True 
 392                          time.sleep(cadence) 
 393                  self._handle_note_after(note=note) 
 394                  return False

 486                  """Send string as a shell command, and wait until the expected output

 488                  returning. The expected string will default to the currently-set

 494                  @param send: String to send, ie the command being issued. If set to None, we consume up to the expect string, which is useful if we just matched output that came before a standard command that returns to the prompt.

 500                  @param record_command: Whether to record the command for output at end. As a safety measure, if the command matches any 'password's then we don't record it.

 503                  @param escape: Whether to escape the characters in a bash-friendly way, ie $'\Uxxxxxx' 
 504                  @param retry: Number of times to retry the command if the first attempt doesn't work. Useful if going to the network 
 505                  @param note: If a note is passed in, and we are in walkthrough mode, pause with the note printed

 507                  @return: The pexpect return value (ie which expected string in the list matched) 
 508                  @rtype: string
